The numeric value "-99999" means no transactions.
The most typical of those offered by the major chartered banks.

Prior to April 1973, the rates are averages of rates posted by major finance company participants in the market. From July 1966 to March 1973, the average was weighted by the amount of paper outstanding for each of the finance companies in the average; prior to that time it was unweighted. Between March 1973 and February 1979, the rate shown is the Bank of Canada's best estimate of operative market trading levels for major finance company paper borrowers.
Mid-market rates for typical quotes.

The yields refer to direct debt payable in Canadian dollars, excluding extendible issues and Canada Savings Bonds. Prior to 1975, some extendible issues are included but their inclusion does not materially affect the calculated average yields. Calculated from the last Wednesday mid-market closing prices.

Bank of Canada estimate at which investment dealers were able to arrange most of their overnight financing of money market inventory, excluding chartered bank day-to-day loans and purchase and resale agreements with the Bank of Canada. The rates are seven-day average for the week ending with the last Wednesday of the month.

Prior to 1978, the rate shown is a simple average of rates charged by a number of large institutional lenders, including chartered banks for residential mortgage loans as at mid-month. Between 1967 and 1970, the average rate shown includes rates for twenty-five year mortgages. Prior to 1967, the average rate shown is exclusively for twenty-five year mortgages.
Month-end.
